title: Cocktail Guide and Notes
introduction: Welcome to the ultimate cocktail guide. Here you'll find categories of cocktails, how to create your own, and tips on adding to your bar.

sections.subtitle: Cocktail Categories
sections.body: Cocktail categories help organize drinks by their style, ingredients, and preparation method. Below you can find the main categories and what defines them.

subsections.headline: Sours
subsections.description: Sours are classic cocktails that balance a base spirit with citrus juice and a sweetener, often shaken and served over ice.

subsections.headline: Highballs
subsections.description: Highballs are simple mixed drinks consisting of a base spirit and a larger proportion of a non-alcoholic mixer, served over ice in a tall glass.

subsections.headline: Spirit-Forwards
subsections.description: Spirit-forward cocktails emphasize the base spirit with minimal mixers, often stirred and served neat or on the rocks.

subsections.headline: Mocktails
subsections.description: Mocktails are non-alcoholic beverages designed to mimic the complexity and flavor of traditional cocktails. If no alcohol is in the ingredients the cocktail belongs to this category.

subsections.headline: Tiki Cocktails
subsections.description: Tiki cocktails are tropical, often rum-based drinks with exotic fruit juices and elaborate garnishes.

subsections.headline: Duos and Trios
subsections.description: Duos and Trios are simple combinations of two or three ingredients that highlight the interplay of flavors.

subsections.headline: Champagne Cocktails
subsections.description: Champagne cocktails incorporate sparkling wine with other ingredients to create festive and elegant drinks.

subsections.headline: Juleps and Smashes
subsections.description: Juleps and smashes are refreshing cocktails typically featuring muddled herbs, citrus, and a base spirit, served over crushed or cracked ice.

subsections.headline: Others
subsections.description: This category includes cocktails that don't fit neatly into the other classifications but are worth exploring.
